question: What is the purpose of the WWW2023 conference?
answer: To present and discuss progress in research, development, standards, and applications of the topics related to the Web. The conference assembles scholars, researchers, policymakers, practitioners, and end-users with one unifying goal: to envision and create the future of the Web.

question: What is the date of the WWW2023 conference?
answer: From April 30, 2023 to May 4, 2023.

question: What is the location of the WWW2023 conference?
answer: Austin, Texas, USA.

question: Will there be any virtual components to the WWW2023 conference?
answer: The 2023 ACM Web Conference is an in-person conference with virtual components including live streaming of ceremonies and keynotes, access to pre-recorded videos of talks, and the Whova platform for interaction with all conference attendees.

question: What is the deadline for registration
answer: April 29, 2023

question: What is the deadline for submission in research tracks?
answer: October 13, 2022.

answer: January 25, 2023.

question: Will there be a closing ceremony or a special event at the end of the conference?
answer: Yes, there will be a closing ceremony at the end of the conference.

question: when is the closing ceremony of this conference?
answer: From 3:30pm to 4:00pm on May 4th.

question: Can the conference provide visa letter for attendees?
answer: Yes

question: What are the eligibilities for applying for student travel award
answer: To apply you must be a student (undergraduate, graduate and PhDs are welcome to apply). Preference will be given to those applicants presenting (papers/posters) at the conference. Note that for co-authored papers, only the first author is eligible to apply for the award unless he, she, zhe, or them is unable to attend the conference.
from: WWW2023/Attendees/Student Travel Award/The Zhipu Student Travel Awards for the 2023 ACM The Web Conference Call for Student Travel Award Applications/Eligibility

question: When is the application deadline for the student travel grant?
from: WWW2023/Attendees/Student Travel Award/The Zhipu Student Travel Awards for the 2023 ACM The Web Conference Call for Student Travel Award Applications/How to apply/Application Deadline

question: When is the student travel scholarship notification?
answer: Notification for student travel grants is March 31, 2023.
from: WWW2023/Attendees/Student Travel Award/The Zhipu Student Travel Awards for the 2023 ACM The Web Conference Call for Student Travel Award Applications/How to apply/Notifications

question: What is the Virtual Participation Award?
answer: Virtual Participation Award is a Fair Access Virtual Participation Award that provides selected applicants with a free-of-charge registration for Virtual Conference registration. This award is given out by ACM SIGWEB to a limited number of participants in order to foster an accessible and inclusive conference.
from: WWW2023/Attendees/Virtual Participation Award/The ACM SIGWEB Fair Access Virtual Participation Awards - Call for Applications/Introduce

question: What are the requirements for obtaining the Virtual Participation Award?
answer: To be eligible for the Virtual Participation Award, an applicant must be a student (undergraduate, graduate and PhDs are welcome to apply) connected to a university or research laboratory based in a country designated by ACM as “economically developing”. Further preference may be given to those coming from underrepresented regions.
from: WWW2023/Attendees/Virtual Participation Award/The ACM SIGWEB Fair Access Virtual Participation Awards - Call for Applications/Eligibility

question: When and where this conference was first held?
answer: The World Wide Web was first conceived in 1989 by Tim Berners-Lee at CERN in Geneva, Switzerland.

question: What is the full name of this conference?
answer: The Web Conference

question: What is the time period of rebuttal in research track?
answer: From December 15 to December 22, 2022.
from: WWW2023/calls/Research Tracks/TheWebConf 2023 Research Tracks Final Call For Papers (CFP) 'Web Research with Openness, Fairness and Reproducibility'/Instructions for authors of research tracks submissions/ImportantDates/Rebuttal

question: Who are the tutorial chairs?
answer: The tutorial chairs are Olaf Hartig and Valeria Fionda.

question: Who are the workshop chairs?
answer: The workshop chairs are Riccardo Tommasini and Femke Ongenae.

question: How can I contact tutorial chairs?
answer: You can contact them at tutorial2023@thewebconf.org.

question: How can I contact workshop chairs?
answer: You can contact them at workshop2023@thewebconf.org.

question: What is the main focus of the Industry Track of The Web Conference 2023?
answer: The Industry Track focuses on showcasing original results obtained in an industrial environment, with clear industry relevance, and highlighting new research challenges motivated by practical tasks and settings.

question: How will The Web Conference 2023 handle submissions in industry track?
answer: Submissions will be handled via Easychair at https://easychair.org/conferences/?conf=thewebconf2023iwpd.

question: Where will accepted papers in Industry track for The Web Conference 2023 be published?
answer: Accepted papers will be published in the companion proceedings of The Web Conference, in the ACM Digital Library.

question: What new approach is The Web Conference 2023 taking regarding the FAIR principles?
answer: The Web Conference 2023 will embrace the FAIR principles by collecting structured metadata of the datasets, software, and methods generated by all paper submissions.

question: What was the deadline for the Research Track Abstract submission?
answer: October 6, 2022.

question: When was the deadline for Tutorials Proposal submission?
answer: November 10, 2022.
